# startMonitoring()

**Instance Method**

Begins monitoring the device’s active scene and making framing recommendations.

## Declaration

```swift
func startMonitoring() throws
```

## Discussion

The monitor’s [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSmartFramingMonitor/recommendedFraming] is `nil` when it is not actively running. Call this method to start monitoring. You may start monitoring before or after calling [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSession/startRunning()],  and you may stop active monitoring without stopping the capture session by calling [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSmartFramingMonitor/stopMonitoring()] at any time, but you must set [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSmartFramingMonitor/enabledFramings] before running your capture session so that the monitor is prepared for your desired framing recommendations. While the monitor is running, you may set [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSmartFramingMonitor/enabledFramings] at any time to change the framing choices the monitor should consider in its recommendations.

## Managing the life cycle

- **isMonitoring**: Yes when the receiver is actively monitoring.
- **stopMonitoring()**: Stops monitoring the device’s active scene and making framing recommendations.
